page.title: 19Houses Thornley Knowle Green
page.content: This area is Green Belt which means that planning permision for new houses is seldom obtainable. The only plans accepted are for the conversion of existing disused barns etc. to houses, and there are many examples of this type of development. The widely scattered farm houses and cottages are mainly built of local stone with slate roofs. Where the land of small farms has been put to larger units, the old farmhouse has often been enlarged by the addition of extra rooms, some converted from adjoining barns. In other cases, disused agricultural buildings have been tuirned into cottages keeping their original floor-area and essential features such as large barn-doors and slate roofs.
